abstract.text: Creates a new audio file and associates it with a new extended audio file object.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The URL of the new audio file.
The type of file to create, specified as a constant from the
enumeration.
The format of the audio data to be written to the file.
The channel layout of the audio data. If non-null, this must be consistent with the number of channels specified by the
parameter.
Flags for creating or opening the file. If the
flag is set, it erases an existing file. If the flag is not set, the function fails fails if the URL points to an existing file.
On output, a newly allocated extended audio file object.
A result code.
If the file to be created is in a compressed format, you may set the sample rate in the
parameter to
. In all cases, the extended file object’s encoding converter may produce audio at a different sample rate than the source. The file will be created with the audio format produced by the encoder.

abstract.text: Record or play audio, convert formats, parse audio streams, and configure your audio session.
Operating system constants that indicate the type of file to be written or a hint about what type of file to expect from data provided.
Creates a new audio file and associates it with a new extended audio file object.
Disposes of an extended audio file object and closes the associated file.
Opens an existing audio file for reading, and associates it with a new extended audio file object.
An opaque structure representing an extended audio file object.
Wraps an audio file object in an extended audio file object.
A structure that specifies a channel layout in a file or in hardware.
A format specification for an audio stream.
A reference to a CFURL object.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
